data.title: Good food in a fun place.
data.text:
This quirky little place just a few blocks west of Broadway in what is basically a mid century used furniture store is a fun throwback in time.  Check out the walls hung with little tin stoves and refrigerators that children used to play with long ago.  It'll make you smile.
But the food is modern and healthful and delicious.
My daughter and I had a salad with a divine dressing and a smoked brisket sandwich with sauerkraut and cheese.  I think the sauerkraut was made in house.  Excellent.
I think the chef is the same one who made flourless chocolate cake in another location we ate at once.  That was so wonderful she should do it again at this place.
I heard this was a bagel place, but it is much more than that.  We loved the place and the food.  
If we get back to Fargo, we know where we will have lunch--at BernBaum's!

data.title: Funky Vibes & Great Food
data.text: Chef Andrea Baumgardner has done it again. We have enjoyed eating wherever she cooks for many years. Bernbaum's features homemade bagels with all sorts of delightful and interesting toppings and sides. We also had the sweet potato soup and a salad. Both were wonderful. Bernbaum's shares space with the Mod House, so you can enjoy your meal while admiring vintage maps and furniture from the 1950s.
